Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so now hubs are charging for routing info?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what prevents a hub from only publishing routes using its own affiliated set of hubs?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we end up with half a dozen major hubs that everybody routes through

Author: garbonzo607#4659
Content: I'm just wondering if the centralized system can be replicated in a trustless manner. Perhaps no need to reinvent the wheel.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe it can, maybe it cant. doing this is exactly the very difficult problem of decentralized systems and LN did not solve this (yet), nor is there anything that appears to be close to solving it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but in 6 months it will take over the world, just 6 months to go

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: like making a DEX, even after you solve the core tech, there are still many usability issues to solve

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the routing and incentives for LN hubs seems left to its own devices

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the fundamental problem is that if hubs are making money, then the txfees arent being reduced

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which was one of the big points about LN that was supposed to compensate for its being an interactive protocol and not noninteractive

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: given some large nonprofit that funds development for routing services and pays the costs of these nodes, then I can see how I could solve the dynamic routing issue.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but i dont have much motivation to do it

Author: garbonzo607#4659
Content: You say maybe it can't, but it works in my noob mind. I feel like every economic action that requires trust can just replace trust with crypto deposits and trust is no longer needed. We can't prevent bad things from happening, but we can make sure we are made whole with the appropriate compensation. I know there's a lot of building to do to get to that world, but why wouldn't it be possible? We have the building blocks.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: We also have an already built building

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: well, yes, scaling is solvable in a better way

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so why not do that instead

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: channels CC allows for instant payments secured by dPoW

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i hope to add tokens support to channels, so you can channels send tokenized BTC instantly

Author: garbonzo607#4659
Content: Do Komodo projects not need sharding, since they can just create multiple blockchains, or is sharding still useful?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: sharding is like going from an omelet to the original eggs (and ingredients)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with KMD method, you never even mix the eggs together, there is nothing to shard (a very very complex problem that makes LN routing look simple)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: why to combine things into a single chain, just to separate them out again (sharding)?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: why not just have dedicated chains for each usage, then only people that care about that would even load that chain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: its one of those common sense things that is too simple, so it doesnt get a lot of cool sounding jargon

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: nothing more needs to be done if you can make a set of chains fungible with each other, securely
